properties.areaDesc: Winnebago; Manitowoc; Door; Calumet; Outagamie; Brown; Kewaunee
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 12 at 9:08PM CST by NWS Green Bay WI
properties.description:
The leading edge of an arctic front extended from south of
Wisconsin Rapids to just north of Waupaca to Kimberly to northern
Manitowoc County as of 9 pm. As the front passes, a period of
moderate snow with visibilities of around a half of mile can be
expected, especially across Waupaca, Outagamie, Calumet and
Manitowoc Counties. Wind gusts to around 35 mph are also possible
with the passage of the front. The arctic front should exit the
area by 10 pm.

The combination of the falling snow, along with melting snow on
pavement surfaces and falling air temperatures well below freezing
could lead to a flash freeze by late evening. Gusty northerly
winds may also create some areas of blowing and drifting snow.

Overnight, temperatures are expected to fall into the single
digits to around 10 above zero. The combination of the cold
temperatures and gusty northerly winds will produce wind chill
readings down to around 10 below zero late tonight into Thursday
morning. Wind chill readings this low can produce frost bite in 30
minutes.

Allow extra travel time if you will be driving tonight as roads
will be slippery due to ice or snow. If venturing outdoors overnight,
wear layers of clothing along with a hat and gloves to protect
yourself from the cold.

NWSheadline: HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS FOLLOWED BY COLD WIND CHILLS OVERNIGHT
